name: 英語會話（二）
restrict: ◎限大二修習◎必須先修過【ENU0281  英語發音（一）】、【ENU0282  英語發音（二）】
description: 本課旨在提高學生英語會話之動機與信心，擴展其英語會話相關知識，及提昇其英語會話技巧。藉由導正參與會話之心態及學習與會話相關之言談特色、溝通策略、肢體語言及社會文化，學生可望在不同場合(如一般社交和工作面試)面對不同人士或使用不同溝通媒介(面對面或講電話)時以更輕鬆的心情及更適切的方式參與、進行（即開啟、延續、及結束）英語會話。本課程之授課方式主要以兩人對話型式討論相關文獻及運用演練所學之會話知識和技巧。學習評量包含學生個人的平時課堂參與、課堂小考、二至三段考以及小組與個人報告等。
goals: Acquire the attitude that is conducive to having English conversation.
Know the stages involved in the English conversation process.
Acquire the skills to open, sustain and close an English conversation.
Learn the vocabulary for topics commonly mentioned in daily conversations.
Acquire the skills to perform FTA’s (Face Threatening Acts) like requesting, rejecting a request, hiding true feelings, and deflecting embarrassing questions.
Learn how to conduct phone conversations.
Acquire the knowledge and ability to conduct conversations at a job interview.
syllabus:
**Objectives**: The goal of this course is to enhance students’ English speaking competence by **broadening their scope** of English conversation and **enhancing their communication skills in real-life situations**. At the same time, it will try to **build confidence** and **motivate** them to **actively participate in English conversation autonomously**. In order to do so, there will again be a **five-pronged approach** to the course this semester:

1.  Firstly, the **course textbook** presents natural language in authentic contexts, and helps **develop conversation management strategies**.
2.  Secondly, there will also be **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of areas and at appropriate times, so that students can to familiarize themselves with topical language spoken in various popular settings.
3.  Thirdly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **task-based project**, in which task groups are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are of interest to them, and then **present their work** to the class**.**
4.  Fourthly, over the course of the second-half of the semester, there will be an emphasis on **teaching practice** in relation to conversation**.** In pairs or groups of three, students will **plan a 30-minute+ lesson** in a series of stages and then **teach it to the class.** Learning how to plan a conversation class will provides students with a real-life experience and real interface between being a student and becoming a member of the teaching profession.
5.  Finally, students need to **practice speaking** **English** outside of class. All significant autonomous English-language encounters (around 8 experiences) should be **recorded in a notebook/portfolio** and handed in at the end of the semester.

**All five elements** **will be evaluated/assessed** when calculating the final grade.
